context: When user has missed multiple days

quotes.text: The mind is restless, O Arjuna, turbulent, strong and obstinate. But it can be controlled by practice and detachment.
Yoga is not lost for one who has fallen. He is reborn in the house of the pure and prosperous.
Neither in this world nor the next is there destruction for him. No one who does good ever comes to grief.

context: When user consistently marks practices as mechanical

quotes.text: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer, do it as an offering to Me.
Perform your duty with a steady mind, abandoning attachment to success or failure.
Action without attachment is the secret of yoga. Let the work be your meditation.

context: When user has many focused practices

quotes.text: Yoga is skill in action.
When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
The self-controlled man, moving among objects with senses under restraint, attains serenity.

context: When user has been consistent for a week+

quotes.text: Little by little, through patience and repeated effort, the mind will become stilled.
Established in yoga, perform actions. Success and failure are the same.
What seems like poison at first, but tastes like nectar in the end — that is sattvic happiness.

context: For users in their first week

quotes.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
In this path, no effort is ever lost. Even a little practice protects from great fear.
Set your heart upon your work, but never on its reward.
At the end of the day, let the Witness observe without judgment.
Calmly contemplate, observe the breath, and rest in the space between thoughts.
He who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is wise among men.
Brahma Muhurta is the time of Brahma — creation energy is at its peak.
The early morning has gold in its mouth.
One who rises at Brahma Muhurta protects their life like the Lotus protects its purity in muddy water.

context: User is in the middle of 66-day tapasya

quotes.text: Tapas burns away impurities, revealing the jewel within.
By austerity, study, and surrender to Ishvara, kriya yoga is practiced.
The heated gold becomes pure. The heated soul becomes divine.
